titleStmt.title: Letter, Robert A. Ragan in Camp near Lick Creek Bridge to Emeline Ragan, 1863 November 12

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives

availability.p: The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library.

bibl.title: Letter, Robert A. Ragan in Camp near Lick Creek Bridge to Emeline Ragan, 1863 November 12

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for The University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Corrections have been applied to the text only where there is a high degree of certainty of an error and if the correct spelling is known.
Corrections are represented by editorial tags.
Quotation marks and apostrophes have been replaced by entity references.
All unambiguous end-of-line hyphens have been removed.
Names of persons, places, and organizations are indicated in the transcription when identifiable with a high degree of certainty.

keywords.term: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Religious aspects.

revisionDesc.change: Updated earlier transcription from the old TEI.2 system to anticipate and resolve difficulties and issues with re-formatting letters from this collection into TEI-P5 lite.

Added "idno" element, editorial declaration statement, subjects/keywords and abstracts from EAD finding aid. Removed box and folder notes, reference declaration element. Changed the formatting for blank pages. Added resp attributes to editorial changes, and added name tags.

opener.dateline: Camp Near Lick Creek Bridge Nov 12 1863

div.p: I have the pleasure this Eavening of Seating My Self to drop You a few Lins I heard Something this Morning and I was glad to hear that our forces had got after Bill Nelson all that I am a frade of is tha they wont get him Andy Winters come to our camps this morning and Said that they was fighting about Parrotsville I wish I had bin there So I Could have got to Shoot at that hsavlsh Black hearted Bill Nelson
That Night I left I went to Yenipling Lins and him and Lincoln sonh merit walk me to rersbng I have bin well Sence toea

With the Exception of the look hnkie but I am better If It to days I went to the Other day to worrying with the trains after conn I made old ng Karl & Kill Jc ngs & nall I taken live loads of Corn Kinser is threads and of Office I expect the Col. told Alexander that I Should be Captan, of the Company & Alex Will be first Lt. I heard to day our forces had taken a Grate Many prisners below and that they had got possession of Look Out Mountain, that is Close to to ChatanoogaChattanooga.
I heard to day that the pay master was on the road here. I am afrade the Rebels has taken all I have and all youre father has. Andy Winters Sertha
they had not bin up there I am in hope they have not I have bin reading one of Brownlows papers to day. I want to send You one to read and you can afet the histry of the Rebles

Emms I am going to Send you Some Coffee & I will Send You some Sugar Some other time I think I No things happens. I will be at home before long If I can get affs I want you to write to me as often as you can and I will do the Same. It is want You in of our part use paper approved will buy Bill Winters and when ever you can get the chance tell Your Mother to take Some of that Coffee
I Will have bring few Lins to a Close Yestry R Raga
